nodes.text: Twins were two siblings born at the same time from the same parents. Luke Skywalker and Leia Organa were the twin children of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala. Other twins included Tiplar and Tiplee, two Mikkian Jedi Masters who fought in the Clone Wars. Technically speaking, a clone was also the twin of his or her template, since the two shared the exact same genetic pattern. As such, Boba Fett was both the adopted son and the twin of Jango Fett. Ciena Ree was the twin of Wynnet Ree, but the latter died a few hours after they were born. Despite never knowing her, Ciena vowed to live her life for the both of them and would think of Wynnet often.

Ben Solo and Rey were not twins by blood, as the former was a Skywalker and the latter a Palpatine. Moreover, they were born a decade apart. Nevertheless, a unique bond existed between them, making Solo and Rey "twins" in the sense that they were a dyad—two beings who were one in the Force.
